title: Business live: Wall Street rallies after oil price boost - BBC News
summary: brent crude rises after us inventory report .
l & g confirms plans to build prefab houses .
woodford : 'brexit ' wo n't necessarily hut uk economy .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's all for another night .
please join us again tomorrow from 06:00 .

documents.title: apple chief : giving fbi access to iphone 'would be bad for america '
text: apple chief executive tim cook has told abc news that giving the fbi the means to access the mobile phone of san bernardino killer syed farook `` would be bad for america . ''
we know that doing this could expose people to incredible vulnerabilities this would be bad for america .
it would also set a precedent that i believe many people in america would be offended by some things are hard , and some things are right , and some things are both .
this is one of those things . ''

documents.title: oil rebound buoys wall street at the close
text: a sharp rebound in crude oil prices has lifted stocks on wall street at the close .

the dow jones industrial average was up 53.21 points , or 0.32 % , to 16,484.99 ; the s & p 500 gained 8.53 points , or 0.44 % , to 1,929.80 , and the nasdaq composite added 39.02 points , or 0.87 % , to 4,542.61 points .

documents.title: are billionaires more likely to be graduates ?
text: are billionaires good with exams as well as their finances ?
or are they more likely to have escaped school at the first opportunity and worked their way up to make their fortunes ?
are they likely to be graduates or to have dropped out from university , wanting to get a head-start in start-ups ?
read more here .

documents.title: us stocks pare earlier losses after crude oil up
text: us stocks have recovered much of earlier losses after a surge in the price of crude oil .
but much of the market is still weighed down by declines in banks , which remain under pressure due to economic unease and worries about the amount of loans on their books to oil and gas companies .

documents.title: moody 's downgrades rio tinto debt
text: moody 's investors service has downgraded rio tinto debt to baa1 from a3 .
the ratings firm said `` fundamental downward shift in the mining sector '' resulted in `` increased credit risk '' both for rio tinto and for the mining sector as a whole .

the slowing economic growth rates in china materially impact the demand for base metals while the reducing steel production rates impact demand for iron ore and metallurgical coal - leading to lower prices .
supply imbalances , particularly in iron ore , the major earnings and cash flow driver for rio tinto , will maintain pressure on prices for several years . ''

documents.title: nike co-founder donates $ 400m to stanford university
text: nike co-founder phil knight is donating $ 400m to stanford university for a scholarship fund .
the knight-hennessy scholars programme now has $ 700m in funding , and is expected to grow to $ 750m , university officials said .

`` we wanted to create something enduring , that would be unlike anything else currently available to the world 's brightest minds , and that would make the biggest impact possible toward solving global challenges affecting the environment , health , education and human rights , '' said stanford president john hennessy , who will serve as the programme 's director after he steps down later this year .

on @ twitterid new top team , @ twitterid says edward troupe 's appointment is `` good news for big biz , bad news for ordinary taxpayers ''

documents.title: target does better than walmart during the holiday season
text: us retailing giant , target , has reported 1.9 % increase in sales , the sixth consecutive quarterly increase , for the period ending 30 january
its rival walmart recorded a 0.6 % increase in its stores .
chief executive , brian cornell , has been focusing the business on a few key categories

documents.title: all change at the tax office hq
text: two new bosses have been announced for hm revenue and customs .
jon thompson becomes the chief executive and edward troup takes up the role of executive chair .

both will start their new jobs in april when the former head lin homer , who faced criticism from mps for `` unacceptable '' customer service and `` disappointing progress '' on tax evasion , leaves .
mr thompson joins hmrc from the ministry of defence and mr troup is already employed at hmrc as the tax assurance commissioner .

documents.title: airbus chief : 'brexit a leap into the unknown '
text: aerospace giant airbus group is a firm which operates across european borders , and has a significant manufacturing base in britain .
airbus group chief executive , tom enders , talks to bbc business reporter theo leggett .
he said that a uk vote to leave the eu `` would be a leap into the unknown '' and that job losses could not be ruled out .

documents.title: ftse closes lower after miners drag
text: the ftse 100 has closed 1.60 % lower at 5,867.18 after mining stocks dragged on the index .

documents.title: deutsche boerse ceo 'would be chairman in lse merger '
text: deutsche boerse chief executive carsten kengeter would become the chairman of a holding company created by the possible merger of the lse group and the german exchange operator , the reuters news agency reports .
the two companies announced on tuesday that they were in merger talks , and that the board of the holding company would be composed of an equal number of lse and deutsche boerse directors .

documents.title: imf : uk referendum one of 'risks and uncertainties ' for uk growth
text: the imf has said that the uk 's eu membership referendum is one of the `` risks and uncertainties '' for uk economic growth in a report :

executive directors welcomed the uk 's strong economic performance , which has delivered robust growth , record high employment , a significant reduction in fiscal deficits , and increased financial sector resilience .

directors noted , however , that the relatively positive outlook is subject to risks and uncertainties , including those related to the global outlook , sluggish productivity growth , a weak external position , still-high levels of household debt , and the forthcoming referendum on eu membership .
they encouraged the authorities to remain vigilant to the challenges ahead and to continue their policy efforts to promote growth and further boost resilience . ''

documents.title: shell us chairman to step down
text: shell 's us chairman marvin odum , who is also in charge of shale oil and the arctic for the firm , is to step down at the end of march , the firm has said .
shell chief executive ben van beurden said :
marvin has had a long and distinguished shell career and i 'm grateful to him for the central role he 's played in the company 's success .
he leaves our important businesses in the americas well positioned for the next phase of their development . ''

documents.title: energy stocks drag on wall street as oil slips
text: wall street is lower as energy stocks took a hit from a slide in oil prices after saudi arabia ruled out a cut in output .
stocks have closely tracked oil prices this year as investors fret about the health of the global economy .
the s & p 500 is down 6 % for the year , while the nasdaq composite has shed more than 10 % .
us crude was down more than 3 % , also pressured by data showing an increase in stockpiles .
shares of chevron were down 1.68 % , while exxon fell 1.48 % .
`` there is very little good news for the market to hang its hat on , '' said john brady , managing director at brokerage r.j. o'brien & associates in chicago .
`` unless something happens , my sense is that we 're going to continue to break down here a little bit , '' he added .

documents.title: moody 's cuts brazil debt to junk
text: moody 's has become the third major rating agency to downgrade brazil 's debt to junk , cutting its rating by two notches to ba2 , as the country sinks deeper into recession .
moody 's said there was a risk of further external shocks .
sa fighting fit to avoid a credit-ratings downgrade , fellow brics member brazil has just received its 3rd `` junk status '' grading # moody 's

documents.title: robot 'puts up with bullying'north america technology reporter dave lee writes
text: boston dynamics - the robotics firm owned by google - has created a humanoid that is able to withstand all manner of bullying and still achieve its task .
researchers push , kick and tease the remarkable new atlas robot , which is an upgrade of models we 've seen from the firm previously .
despite the distractions , atlas continues with its task of up and moving boxes .
in one instance , a member of the boston dynamics team gives atlas such a severe whack to its upper back that it falls over , face first on to the floor .
read more here .

documents.title: lobby group : 'fracking traffic can be minimised '
text: uk onshore oil and gas ( ukoog ) , a lobbying group for the fracking industry , has responded to research by newcastle and durham universities which suggested that fracking can significantly increase local vehicle traffic and pollution , and noise at night .
ken cronin , chief executive of ukoog , said :

this report into the traffic-related environmental impacts of hydraulic fracturing operations released by refine , uses us data , and does n't take account of the uk 's strict regulatory and planning regimes which require logistics planning and integrated traffic management to be a part of every planning application .
permitting and planning systems restrict truck movements at night and at certain times of the day .
additionally the report 's conclusions fail to take into account , that in the uk , water is more often available through pipelines , so there is no need to transport it across the country by truck .
the uk has a long history of onshore exploration , successfully mitigating traffic impacts at other onshore locations .

the industry is also working with transport and logistics experts currently to identify key principles for the minimisation of traffic impacts at production sites , learning from best practice at other significant infrastructure projects . ''

documents.title: wall street opens lower as crude prices slide again
text: us stocks were lower at the open as crude prices slid after top producer saudi arabia ruled out production cuts .
the dow jones industrial average fell 90.26 points , or 0.55 % , to 16,341.52 .
the s & p 500 lost 12.61 points , or 0.66 % , falling to 1,908.66 and the nasdaq composite index dropped 48.64 points , or 1.08 % , to 4,454.94 .

documents.title: sa mobile phone firm mtn withdraws fine lawsuit
text: south african mobile phone operator mtn group has withdrawn a lawsuit against nigeria 's regulator over a $ 3.9bn fine and paid $ 250m towards a possible settlement .

a judge in lagos last month gave both parties until 18 march to reach a settlement , after mtn had asked the court to arbitrate over the dispute , saying the nigerian communications commission ( ncc ) had no legal grounds to order the fine .

mtn , which makes 37 % its sales in nigeria , said it would withdraw its court challenge in an effort to reach an amicable settlement and make a `` good faith payment '' of $ 250m towards a possible settlement .
`` this is a sign that the fine could be reduced much further .
there is some sort of negotiation taking place and the parties are migrating towards a common ground , '' said dobek pater , managing director of africa analysis .
story we missed in midst of sa budget frenzy - apparently mtn has paid that hefty fine in nigeria # bbc africalive news page

just a small portion $ 250m and pulled the matter from the high court final fine amount not yet agreed btw .
@ twitterid so after $ 250million they must still settle .
rough
@ twitterid they are negotiating to take it down .
so the payment is a sign of good faith - for both the market and nigerian regulators

documents.title: ryanair backs 'in ' campaign
text: budget airline ryanair has `` called for a big 'yes ' vote '' in the uk eu referendum , and says it will actively campaign to stay in europe .
it says it `` remains a committed supporter of the uk remaining in europe '' because :

this will lead to more uk jobs and better economic growth ; eu open skies has transformed uk tourism and job creation prospects ; the free movement of goods and services has made the uk one of europe 's most competitive and best performing economies ; david cameron 's negotiated reforms protect sterling , limits immigration and closer union , while reducing bureaucracy ; and foreign inward investment in the uk will be lost to ireland and germany if the uk leaves europe . ''

text: manuela saragosa talks to architect toby burgess from the university of westminster in london about the future uses of virtual reality .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: hmrc does not settle for less tax than is due
text: hmrc has responded to the public accounts committee report on its google tax deal .
hmrc does not settle for a penny less than is due under the law from multinationals .
last year we brought in an additional £ 7bn by rigorously enforcing the tax rules that apply to large businesses .
we completely understand that there is a real appetite for as much information and insight as possible into how we pursue the tax payable by multinationals .
we are committed to being as open and transparent as we can within the constraints of our statutory duty of taxpayer confidentiality .
the uk has played a leading role in the oecd to strengthen international standards and to make global tax laws work better and we will continue to do so .
the penalty rules will change this year to better support those who play by the rules and the pac has welcomed that .

there will also be a legal requirement for large businesses to publish their tax strategy for uk activities plus a new special measures approach which will target those large businesses with a persistent record for aggressive tax planning .

documents.title: ftse and pound still lower
text: shares and the pound are still down amid uncertainty over the global economy and the uk 's position in europe .
the ftse 100 , which opened down 23.97 at 5,938.34 points , extended losses to stand down 98.07 at 5,867.23 - a loss of 1.5 % .
the pound remained at seven-year lows .
against the dollar , sterling lost a further 1 % to $ 1.3884 .
against the euro it fell 0.4 % to €1.2675 .
the pound has lost 5 % against the dollar in a week .
barratt was up 1 % after it reported a 40 % gain in half price profits .
other housebuilders took three of the top five gainers ' slots on the ftse 100 .

text: south africa 's minister of finance , pravin gordhan , is delivering the country 's budget in parliament
budget deficit to be reduced to 3.2 % this year. ``
indeed a tightening of the belt '' says pravin gordhan , sa minister of finance # budget2016
catch phrases # budget2016 - pg says `` dignified employment '' `` progress in society '' `` public ethic built on values of honesty & integrity ''
pravin gordhan , relaxed despite being weighed down by fact that sa sits on a preci fine line between slow growth & recession +downgrade

documents.title: retail sales fall for second month in february
text: uk shop sales cooled for a second month in february and retailers ' expectations for sales in the month ahead eased to their lowest level since 2013 , an industry survey for the confederation of british industry shows .
the sales balance of the cbi 's distributive trades survey fell to +10 from +16 in january .

a measure of expected sales for the month ahead fell to +2 from +10 , its lowest level since may 2013 , while the survey showed retailers expect to scale back investment spending slightly in the year ahead .

documents.title: hmrc 'unable to collect a fair share ' of corporation tax
text: the pac has also savaged hmrc , which it says `` seems unable to collect a fair share '' of corporation tax from global companies in the uk because international rules are not working '' .
google did not pay a penalty as part of its settlement and complex rules make it easier for large businesses to avoid being fined than the average taxpayer , pac adds .
the committee called for reforms punishing businesses for failing to pay tax to be introduced swiftly .
pac chair meg hillier said : `` hmrc itself has identified that the current penalty regime treats corporations differently from individual taxpayers .
`` that is why we are calling on hmrc to take a lead in reforming international tax rules .
the bigger prize after a costly six-year investigation would have been to develop a new approach to the activities of internet-based companies .
`` we are not convinced hmrc has achieved this and it must work with overseas tax authorities if we are to see lasting and effective change in the international tax system . ''

documents.title: google tax deal 'small '
text: mps on the house of commons public accounts have criticised the government 's tax deal with google as `` disproportionately small '' when compared with the size of the company 's business in the country .
google , a unit of alphabet , agreed to pay £ 130m in back taxes to britain in january prompting criticism from opposition politicians and campaigners .
the pac called on hmrc to monitor the outcome of other tax authorities ' investigations into google and re-open its settlement with the company if relevant new evidence became available .

documents.title: sterling down almost 1 %
text: the pound remains under pressure for a third day and is down almost 1 % against the us dollar at $ 1.3893 .
the fall came as an opinion poll showed those campaigning to stay in the european union in june 's referendum still ahead but support fading .
the comres poll .
showed 51 % of voters would opt to stay in the eu , while 39 % would vote to leave and 10 % of voters said they were undecided .
the poll is the second to show support narrowing for the in campaign .
some analysts are warning sterling could fall as low as $ 1.35 a level last seen in 2009 .
the pound has shed some .
3 % since the start of the week when several senior members of david cameron 's cabinet threw their weight behind the campaign to leave the eu .

documents.title: scotgold resources , mining for gold near tyndrumbbc scotland business and economy editor tweets
text: scotgold resources , mining for gold near tyndrum , plans on-site trial this spring , crushing 2400 tonnes of ore already extracted .
scotgold resources ' cononish mine bulk trial , may-oct : target is 500 ounces gold , marketable at 'ethical ' , scottish , premium price .

documents.title: banks report new year buy-to-let rush
text: major banks have provided more evidence of a burst of activity in the uk mortgage market by landlords keen to avoid a stamp duty rise .
in january , gross mortgage borrowing from the high street banks rose to its highest level since mid-2008 .
the number of mortgages approved for house purchases was 27 % higher than a year earlier , the british bankers ' association ( bba ) said .
the bba said that investors were keen to complete before tax changes .
from the start of april , most owners in england and wales will pay a 3 % surcharge on stamp duty on purchases of buy-to-let properties and second homes .

documents.title: nurofen tv advert withdrawn by makers
text: a tv advert for nurofen express has been withdrawn by makers reckitt benckiser .
the advert implied that the capsules directly targeted muscles in the head .
the company says it will not re-broadcast it following complaints that the ad was misleading .
news understands the company has promised the advertising standards authority it will not imply the product has a mechanism that makes it especially effective for headache pain .
the asa has halted an investigation which could have led to the ad being banned .

documents.title: aston martin plumps for wales
text: luxury car maker aston martin has announced it 's to manufacture its new dbx model - which will be a snip at £ 166,000 - at st athan in wales .
the town , in the vale of glamorgan , beat off competition from 20 other potential sites around the world .

on the today programme earlier andrew palmer , chief executive of aston martin , said grant aid was a factor in the choice but `` what was much more interesting was the ability to bring the car in time and the quality of the workforce and the passion local government there to bring aston martin to wales . ''
he was also asked if the looming eu referendum affected was a factor in the decision making .
`` not at all , '' he insisted .
`` i do n't think you can make selection based on hypotheses of what might or might not happen .
`` all i would wish and i guess what businesses would wish is the we maintain free trade and a stable economy . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

text: # singapore saw its economy grow at the slowest pace since 2009 .
earlier on # bbcbizlive

documents.title: privately educated still dominate professions
text: leading british actors are more than twice as likely as stars in the music industry to have attended fee-paying schools , the sutton trust says .
it also says professions like politics and the law continue to be dominated by privately educated oxbridge graduates .
the trust said a child 's chances of reaching the top still came down to their schooling and contacts .
the government said the state sector was increasingly matching the private sector in terms of academic attainment .

researchers for the trust , which campaigns for greater social mobility , looked at the educational backgrounds of more than 1,200 people , working in high positions in medicine , the law , the military , journalism , politics , the civil service , business , film and pop music .

documents.title: business live reader welcomes danish surplus food supermarket
text: what a wonderful idea .
bravo , dan church aid , and i hope a lot more organisations will follow their example .
the amount of food wasted worldwide is scandalous .
incidentally , high-street supermarkets could do a lot to limit it by selling fruit and vegetables loose , as the old fashioned grocer used to do .
i live alone and often just want to buy a carrot or a couple of onions .
instead , i end up having to buy more than i want in a sealed package and half of the food goes off before i can use it .
and i then have to get rid of all the unnecessary packaging !

documents.title: johnson & johnson hit with $ 72m damages in talc-cancer case
text: a jury in the us state of missouri has ordered johnson & johnson to pay $ 72m ( £ 51m ) to the family of a woman who claimed her death was linked to use of the company 's baby powder talc .
jackie fox from birmingham , alabama died of ovarian cancer last year , aged 62 , having used the talc for decades .
her family 's lawyers argued that the firm knew of cancer risks from the product and failed to warn consumers .
johnson & johnson denied the claim and is said to be considering an appeal .

documents.title: hsbc : 'brexit ' could cause sterling collapse
text: sterling could lose up to 15 % of its value and uk economic growth could be up to 1.5 percentage points lower next year if britain votes to leave the european union in june 's referendum , hsbc has said .
the bank says sterling could fall 15-20 % against the dollar towards the lows of the mid-1980s , meaning it would move towards parity with the euro .
a vote for brexit would have potentially huge consequences for all asset classes .
following a vote to leave we think uncertainty could grip the uk economy , triggering a potential slowdown in growth and a collapse in sterling .
the pound is currently trading below $ 1.40 .
the first time in seven years it has been that low .
it is currently 0.24 % lower at $ 1.3987 .
the plunge in sterling could push inflation up by 5 percentage points , and growth could be 1-1.5 % lower , roughly halving the hsbc 's current 2017 growth forecast of 2.3 % .
the hit to growth could be even more severe if the bank of england raises interest rates to counter the sharp fall in sterling , the bank 's analysts say .

documents.title: peugeot citroen shares jump by 4 %
text: shares in peugeot-citroen have jumped by 4 % today and are leading the cac 40 , . following the publication of the french car maker 's annual results .
it says it has hit medium-term targets ahead of schedule , helped by cost cuts , price increases and a recovery in european demand ,
full-year net profits for 2015 were €1.2bn ( £ 944m ) against a loss of €555m in 2014. and the company said it would consider paying a dividend this year .

documents.title: standard chartered leads ftse lower
text: a second bad day for standard chartered .
its shares are among the biggest fallers on the ftse 100 today down 5.66 % at 383.90p .
otherwise , miners are the main losers with glencore down 4.8 % at 123.20p , bhp billiton down 4.3 % at 714.80p .
and anglo american down 3.7 % at 436.30p .
on the up side barratt developments is leading shares among house builders higher with persimmon , taylor wimpey and berkeley group all higher by between 1 % and 2 % .

documents.title: danish supermarket sells only surplus food
text: denmark throws away 700,000 tons of food each year .
at the same time some 800 million people in the world are thought to be living in hunger .
now one organisation has opened the 'wefood ' supermarket , .
selling only surplus food - which would have otherwise been thrown out by bigger retailers .
it sells the food at a reduced price all the profits go to the dan church aid 's work to combat hunger overseas .
birgitte qvist-sørensen is the chief executive of dan church aid , the charity behind the shop - and she tells newsday on bbc world service .
that the shop is aimed at everyone , not just people on low incomes or students .
food waste and hunger in the world is an issue they want everyone to consider .
`` we would like everybody to actually go to our shop and think about what we 're eating and how can we combat food waste , '' she says .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: eu referendum putting downside pressures on pound
text: the pound has fallen to less than $ 1.40 - a level it has n't plumbed since the depths of the financial crisis in 2009 .

yesterday bank of england governor , mark carney , told the treasury select committee there had been a pattern of behaviour in foreign exchange markets `` consistent with the purchase of downside protection against further falls in the currency '' and that it was safe to say that the upcoming eu referendum was one factor in that .

deanne julius , former monetary policy committee member and now at university college london has been on the today programme to talk about it , she says now the eu referendum has been announced we are `` starting to see volatility and probably downside pressures on the currency .
so what , she 's asked .
would happen to sterling in a brexit scenario ?
`` nobody knows , '' shes says .
`` and that 's really what 's happened now .

it 's the uncertainty , especially in a situation like this - the referendum will either come out with a yes or a no - a leave or a stay - and it 's a little hard to have a one way bet , so you tend to bet one direction and take out some protection in case you 're wrong . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: barratt boosted by help to buythe bbc 's personal finance correspondent tweets
text: 40 % jump in profits at barratt house builders , boosted by help to buy

documents.title: barratt developments profits up by 40 %
text: house builder barratt developments has reported a 40 % rise pre-tax profits for the six months to the end of december 2015. to £ 295m
total completions rose 9.4 % to .
7,626 up 9.4 % and revenue was up 19 % at £ 1,875.5m .

documents.title: breakingftse opens down slightly
text: the ftse 100 index has opened 0.14 % lower at 5,953.93 .

documents.title: airbus profits soar 15 %
text: airbus group has reported a 15 % rise in annual net profits and predicted deliveries of more than 650 aircraft in 2016 and a rise in orders to record levels .
the france-based european aerospace group chalked up a net profit of €2.7bn , with sales up 6. % to €64bn .
orders soared to €159bn , sending its order book to a record of more than a trillion euros .
airbus proposed a dividend to shareholders of €1.30 per share , up 8 % from the previous year .

documents.title: 'brexit ' would n't hurt uk economy
text: leaving the eu would not necessarily damage the uk economy , fund manager neil woodford has reiterated .
he said he disagreed with the views expressed by ftse 100 bosses in a letter published on tuesday .
heads of companies including bt , marks & spencer and vodafone said an eu exit would deter investment in the uk .
but mr woodford argued it was very difficult to build a credible economic argument for the uk either staying in or leaving the union .
rather , the debate was a political argument about issues such as immigration and sovereignty , he said .

documents.title: oil price slump hurts weir group profits
text: scottish engineering firm weir group has reported a near 50 % slump in annual pre-tax as its customers continued to delay spending in order to weather the slump in oil prices .
weir , which makes pumps and valves used in oil rigs , said pre-tax profit for the year fell to £ 220m from £ 409m a year earlier .
the company said revenue fell 21 % to £ 1.92bn .

documents.title: l & g boss : we have now got a housing crisis
text: more from legal & general chief executive nigel wilson who is now on the today programme to talk about the insurance company 's plan to build modular homes at a factory in leeds .
`` we have had a problem for many years , we have now got a crisis where young people ca n't get on the housing ladder , '' he says .
`` only 1 % of all the houses we build at the moment are suitable for the senior generation , the mature generation here in the uk . ''
but , says business presenter simon jack , we simply do n't have the workforce to build new houses , do we ?
`` that 's why we 've got to mass produce them in factories , '' says mr wilson .
`` because that 's the most cost efficient , most environmentally efficient way to produce these houses and it will supplement the exiting activity through , traditional means . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: hay reports 7 % rise in half-year profits
text: recruitment consultancy hay has reported a 7 % rise in half year pre-tax profit to £ 82.4m .
but warned that recruitment slowed towards the end of the period as global growth fears intensified .

chief executive , alistair cox said : `` market conditions remained good in many areas , particularly europe , but growth slowed toward the end of the half in the uk and australia as increased global uncertainty impacted sentiment .
`` looking ahead , we are mindful of increasing global uncertainties , but remain positive and see many opportunities to grow . ''

documents.title: catch up with wake up to moneybbc wake up to money presenter tweets
text: in case you had a lie in this morning .
and here 's the podcast

documents.title: competition concerns over exchange merger `` essentially gone ''
text: shares in the london stock exchange shot up by 14 % yesterday making it london 's biggest riser .
the reason , of course , was because the lse and deutsche boerse are in merger talks .
of course , the two exchanges .
tried to strike a deal back in 2000 and in 2004 but a merger was blocked .
now frederic ponzo , managing partner at greyspark , reckons the competition concerns which prompted the european commission to block the merger before have disappeared .

he says if you compare the situation to the `` situation 16 and 12 years ago , that was before the liberalisation - the opening to competition of the stock market - today all the exchanges are competing against each other , you 've got an alternative player , the transaction fees are the lowest in history so there is plenty of competition actually , so that concern is essentially gone. ``
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: our generation pulled up the drawbridge
text: more from nigel wilson of l & g speaking on wake up to money and something a lot of people under the age of 40. might well agree with .
he says younger people have been dealt a bad hand by those that went before them .
`` our generation have been totally unfair with the generations behind us , in terms of housing , in terms of education , in terms of pensions .
we 've really done incredibly well and we 've pulled up the drawbridge , '' he says .

asked if he thinks young people were suffering , he adds : `` i think they are already suffering , they 're coming out of university with huge amounts of debt , it 's virtually impossible to get on the housing ladder unless you 've got the bank of mum and dad to help you .
it 's very different from when i grew up we 've made the necessities of life more expensive and the luxuries like flat screen televisions incredibly cheap .
we 've done it in the wrong order . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 Live

documents.title: money has never been cheaper
text: mark carney talking about zero interest rates may have hurt the pound a little on tuesday says sarah hewin of standard chartered tells wake up to money but the main game is brexit '' .
and it is the prospect of the uk leaving the eu that has led to the 4 % drop in sterling compared to the us dollar since the start of the year .
nigel wilson of legal & general tells wake up to money currency fluctuations are very important to investment decisions .
but he 's much more exercised by the under-investment he is seeing around the world , which he says has dragged us down to zero interest rates '' .
never has there been so much money aroundand so much of it being badly used , '' he says .
the chinese have massively over invested in steel , while people are hording cash all over the world with the japanese proving to be the world 's biggest hoarders .
we are de-equitising all over the world , '' he says .
mr wilson claims there were something like $ 47bn of share buybacks in the us last week alone .
economic growth wo n't come without equity , he warns .
and yet money has never been cheaper so it has never been easier to invest .
author: BBC Radio 5 Live

documents.title: l & g confirms plans to build flat pack houses
text: legal & general , chief executive nigel wilson has confirmed to the bbc reports that the company is planning to build thousands of so-called flat-pack modular homes from a factory in yorkshire .
he said the 600,000 sq ft site would be the biggest facility of its kind in the world .
on wake up to money mr wilson says : we want to see the manufacturing of housing in the uk fundamentally change demand for housing is at an all time high , but supply is pathetic . ''

he adds : this is another one of our initiatives , to build a manufacturing plant , the biggest in the world , here in the uk producing really economic , environmentally efficient houses and creating a lot of new jobs , up in the north . ''
last year l & g said it was committing £ 600m to building around 3,000 homes for rent .
author: BBC Radio 5 Live

documents.title: early days for lse talks
text: it 's very early days but both sides will see cost savings and synergies from a deal this time around , '' sarah hewin of standard chartered tells wake up to money of the merger talks announced by deutsche boerse and london stock exchange on tuesday .
it is , of course , not the first time the two companies have discussed a merger .
but as in the past there will be stumbling blocks not least of which where the new company might be headquartered , she says .
author: BBC Radio 5 Live

documents.title: good morning
text: morning everyone we have full year earnings from airbus and half year earnings from barratt developments .
plus the latest mortgage lending data and some service sector data .
more on all that and whatever low hanging fruit we can it happens .
do stay with us .
author: Matthew West
Business reporter
